answers.answer: sounds normal, I've felt exhausted this entire pregnancy...hopefully I get my energy back after baby. I was diagnosed w/ gestational diabetes a little before 20wks.
It's probably from the test, the drink they give you is hyped with sugars, that's why we're told to fast....
So is my lack of energy maybe a sign I will have gd
All I could say, is wait for your test results, our bodies my respond different.... I'm also waiting for my results....
Have you eaten anything yet, that could also be the problem....
Yea I have eaten. In so nervous about the results

Don't worry yourself too much.... I couldn't even take the test properly this time around.... I just couldn't do the fasting part, if I didn't eat I would feel sick and light headed.... So they just tested my blood without the entire process of the test.... So my test are not going to be as accurate, I could end up being treated for GD and not even have it....

question: Today I had the 3hours glucose test. So I've been sitting for three hours and then I came home to braid a clients hair. I was also sitting for tht for about 4 hours. As I went to lay down it felt as if I ran a Marathon today. I feeling extremely exhausted and my feet are kinda swollen and I feels like the baby is sitting really really low it's alot of pressure and my waist and back is killing me. Is this normal
title: answers please
